intro: Greigia oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca greigia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
